title: MaxPool2d Output Size Issue
body_html:
System Information

  • PyTorch 0.3.1
  • OS: Linux Mint 18.3
  • PyTorch version: 0.3.1
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): Conda
  • Python version: 3.6 (Anaconda 5.1)
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: CUDA 8.0 / CuDNN 7.0.5
  • GPU models and configuration: nVidia GTX 1060

Code

This code reproduce the issue:

maxPoolLayer = nn.MaxPool2d(2)
mA = Variable(torch.randn(1, 1, 25, 25))
mA.size()
mB = maxPoolLayer(mA)
mB.size()

The code output:

torch.Size([1, 1, 12, 12])

Description

According to the MaxPool2d() documentation if the size is 25x25 and kernel size is 2 the output should be 13 yet as seen above it is 12 ( floor( ((25 - 1) / 2) + 1 ) = 13 ).
It seems the last column / row is totally ignored (As input is 24 x 24).

Moreover, the example in documentation won't work as it is missing conversion from torch.float to variable.

body:
## System Information
- PyTorch 0.3.1
- OS: Linux Mint 18.3
- PyTorch version: 0.3.1
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): Conda
- Python version: 3.6 (Anaconda 5.1)
- CUDA/cuDNN version: CUDA 8.0 / CuDNN 7.0.5
- GPU models and configuration: nVidia GTX 1060

## Code
This code reproduce the issue:

```
maxPoolLayer = nn.MaxPool2d(2)
mA = Variable(torch.randn(1, 1, 25, 25))
mA.size()
mB = maxPoolLayer(mA)
mB.size()
```
The code output:
```
torch.Size([1, 1, 12, 12])
```

## Description

According to the [`MaxPool2d()` documentation](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.MaxPool2d) if the size is 25x25 and kernel size is 2 the output should be 13 yet as seen above it is 12 ( `floor( ((25 - 1) / 2) + 1 ) = 13` ).  
It seems the last column / row is totally ignored (As input is 24 x 24).

~~Moreover, the example in documentation won't work as it is missing conversion from `torch.float` to variable~~.
